resource.name: Food Service Inspection Violation Comments
resource.description: This dataset contains specific comments made in association with observed violations during food service inspections conducted by Fulton County Board of Health environmental health specialists.  Each comment cites the code of the violation as documented in the Georgia Department of Public Health Food Service Rules and Regulations and describes the specific observation that was the cause of the violation.  A violation may have more than one comment if there were multiple observations that led to the same violation.
columns_description: A unique numeric identifier for the inspection. This is not part of the source inspection data but rather is a number generated in the process of extracting the data from the source. The Inspection ID will be duplicated for each violation in the dataset associated with the same inspection.
Indicates whether a followup inspection is required.

A number (1, 2 or 3) indicating the risk of food-borne illness based on the menu items served; the food preparation process performed, and the previous food safety history of the food service establishment. The Risk Type determines the frequency at which the establishment must be inspected. Risk Type 3 represents the highest risk and requires the highest frequency of inspection.  Detailed information on risk types can be found at https://dph.georgia.gov/sites/dph.georgia.gov/files/EnvHealth/Food/InterpretationManual/10InterpretationManualInspectionsComplainceProcedures.pdf.
A letter grade based on the score from the inspection prior to the immediately preceding the inspection subject of the record.
The date on which the inspection was conducted.
A letter grade based on the inspection score (A=90-100, B=80-89, C=70-79, U=0-69).
The zip code component of the address of the food service establishment.
The date and time of the end of the inspection.
The date and time of the start of the inspection.
The scheduled date of a followup inspection if needed.
The purpose of the inspection (Initial, Routine, FollowUp, Temporary)
The overall score (0-100) resulting from the inspection
The name of the food service establishment.
The overall score (0-100) resulting from the inspection prior to the immediately preceding the inspection subject of the record.
A letter grade based on the inspection immediately preceding the inspection subject of the record.
The city component of the address of the food service establishment.
The state component of the address of the food service establishment.
The date of the inspection immediately preceding the inspection subject of the record.
The date of the inspection prior to the inspection immediately preceding the inspection subject of the record.
The street number and street name component of the address of the food service establishment.
The overall score (0-100) resulting from the inspection immediately preceding the inspection subject of the record.
An alphanumeric sequence of characters used to uniquely identify each permit required to operate a food service establishment.

domain_metadata.value: The dataset includes violation records for all food service establishments in Fulton County, Georgia.
This dataset will be retained for at least 3 years from its publication date.

resource.name: Revenue
resource.description: This dataset consists of revenue received by the Fulton County government broken down by source, program (unit) and year.  Fulton County revenues have six major sources: taxes, intergovernmental, licenses and permits, charges for services, fines and forfeitures, and other revenues.  The dataset includes revenue from all sources for the previous four years plus year-to-date revenue for the current year.
columns_description: The descriptive name of the department.

An accounting entity with a complete set of self-balancing accounts established to account  for  finances  of  a  specific  function  or  activity.  The  resources  and  uses  are  segregated  from  other  resources and uses for the purpose of carrying on specific activities or attaining specific objectives in  accordance with special regulations, restrictions, or limitations.
A group of related work activities within a department, also known as a program.  Each department has one or more units.
The descriptive name of the unit (program).
The descriptive name of the fund.
The fiscal year in which the revenue was received. For Fulton County, the fiscal year aligns with the the calendar year.

The unique designator used in the accounting system for the department.  A department is a collection of all offices, divisions and other work units, which are under the control of a single department head.
January 1st of the Year in the Year column.

domain_metadata.value: The dataset includes revenue for the five most recent fiscal years

metadata.license: Creative Commons Attribution | NoDerivatives 4.0 International License

resource.name: Strategic Performance Measures
resource.description: The Strategic Performance Measures dataset is comprised of information related to a set high-level performance measures identified as part of the implementation of the Fulton County 2015-2019 Strategic Plan.  Strategic performance measures do not necessarily directly measure the performance of Fulton County departments and programs but rather serve as indicators of progress toward long-term goals that may require collaboration with other governmental agencies, community organizations and the private sector to achieve.  Strategic performance measures fall into one of six priority areas and are updated annually and presented to the Board of Commissioners in a report for each priority area.
columns_description: This is generally used to indicate the political unit (e.g. county) to which the measure applies.  It is typically used to indicate a county against which Fulton County is benchmarked.
Whether the performrance measure is in active use. (Only actively used measures are published.)
The type of measure (number, percentage, or currency).
A description of the source used to derive the performance number.
The unit of measure
The calculation used to derive the performance number if a calculation is used.
A description of the strategic performance measure.
The margin of error when reported by the data source.
The number representing performance for a given reporting period.
The date representing the end of the reporting period. (For example, the date for a number representing the year 2016 would be December 31,2016.)
This is used when a measure is subdivided by category. (For example, the college education rate is subdivided by degree level.)
The name of the strategic performance measure.
This has a value of Yes when the record contains the most recent available for the measure.
Any clarifying notes regarding the performance measure.
One of six strategic priority areas to which each performance measure is aligned.
Unique identifer for each performance measure.

domain_metadata.value: Fulton County Department of the County Manager

resource.name: Capital Projects
resource.description: This dataset includes information on Fulton County capital projects planned, in progress or completed. A capital project is any project or work involving the construction, acquisition, or renovation of any building, structure, or other facility owned or to be acquired by the county. Most capital projects are managed by the Department of Public Works and the Department of Real Estate and Asset Management.
columns_name: Balance as a Percentage of Budget
columns_description: The name of the capital project
A unique identifier for the capital project
This is a short description of the status of the project in regard to the budget.
A description of the capital project
The Fulton County commission district in which the project lies
This is a description of the project status in regard to the schedule.
The county service to which the project is related (e.g. library, facilities, water/sewer)
This is a code indicating the status of the project in regard to budget.
This is a code indicating the sttaus of the project in regard to the schedule.

domain_metadata.value: Fulton County Departments of Public Works and Real Estate and Asset Management

resource.name: County Commission District Boundaries
resource.description: This dataset represents the boundaries of the Fulton County Commission Districts.  The county is divided into six districts each of which is represented by one member of the Board of Commissioners.  The seventh commissioner, who serves as the Chair, represents the county at large.  The boundaries represented in this dataset have been slightly generalized to speed rendering in web applications.
resource.attribution: Fulton County Department of Information Technology, GIS Division
columns_description: A unique identifier for each district.
The official district number.
The geographic coordinates representing the boundary of each district.  Used primarily for rendering in geographic information system (GIS) software.

classification.domain_category: All People Trust Government is Effective, Efficient and Fiscally Sound

resource.name: Vendor Payments
resource.description: This dataset consists of a listing of payments made to Fulton County vendors for poducts and services provided to the County.  The payment records span the period from January 1, 2014 to present.  Included with each payment record is the disbursement date, the department making the payment, the type of service or product, the fund from which the payment is drawn, the payment amount and the name of the vendor to which the payment was made.  This dataset is updated weekly.
columns_description: The name of the fund from which the payment was made (e.g., General Fund, Water and Sewer Fund)
Indicates whether the check is pending or has been cleared.
An alphanumeric code used within the financial system to identify the category into which the payment falls (e.g., Professional Services, Printing, Office Supplies)
The name of the department making the payment
The number of the invoice
The name of the business unit within the department making the payment
An alphanumeric code used within the financial system to identify the department making the payment
The amount of the payment in U.S. dollars.
The date on which the payment was made
The city this vendor code is tied to.
The legal name of the vendor
The fiscal year in which the payment was made
The category of goods or services into which the payment falls (e.g., Professional Services, Printing, Office Supplies)
The date the check was cleared or cancelled.
An alphanumeric code used within the financial system to identify the fund from which the payment was made
An internally generated code uniquely identifying each vendor.  This can be used to join Vendor Payments to the County Vendors dataset containing additional details on each vendor.
A numeric indicator of the month in which the payment was made (1=Janaury, 2=February, etc.)
The number of the check used to make the payment
An alphanumeric code used within the financial system to identify the business unit within the department making the payment
The date the invoice was received from the vendor

resource.name: TSPLOST Project Locations
resource.description: This dataset contains the geographic locations of all TSPLOST projects in Fulton County.  TSPLOST projects are transportation projects funded through the Transportation Special Local Option Sales Tax (TSPLOST).  Each location record links to a project in the TSPLOST Projects dataset based on the Project ID.  This dataset is used in the Fulton County TSPLOST Projects Explorer webpage at https://tsplost.fultoncountyga.gov/projects.  Project locations are linked to TSPLOST Projects using the Project ID field.
columns_description: The geographic coordinates of the project location.
The public name of the project.
A unique identifier for each project location.  The Project ID can be used to link project locations to project details in the TSPLOST Project dataset.

resource.name: Budget and Expenditures
resource.description: This dataset includes the Board of Commissioners-approved operating budget for Fulton County for the four most recent fiscal years.  Also included are actual expenditures.  The budget and expenditures are given at the level of the object, which represents a specific type of spending such as salaries, printing, office supplies, professional services, etc. within each program of each department.  The data can be sorted, filtered and grouped by fiscal year, fund, department, program (unit) and object.
columns_description: The descriptive name of the unit (program).

An accounting entity with a complete set of self-balancing accounts established to account  for  finances  of  a  specific  function  or  activity.  The  resources  and  uses  are  segregated  from  other  resources and uses for the purpose of carrying on specific activities or attaining specific objectives in  accordance with special regulations, restrictions, or limitations.

The unique designator used in the accounting system for the department.  A department is a collection of all offices, divisions and other work units, which are under the control of a single department head.
The amount (in dollars) expended by the indicated object, unit and department in the given fiscal year.
The fiscal year with which the budget and expenditures are associated.  For Fulton County, the fiscal year aligns with the the calendar year.
The amount (in dollars) appropriated to the indicated object, unit and department in the given fiscal year.
The type of spending such as salaries, printing, office supplies, professional services, etc.
The descriptive name of the fund.
The descriptive name of the department.
A code designating the type of spending, also know as the object.
A group of related work activities within a department, also known as a program.  Each department has one or more units.

domain_metadata.value: This dataset includes the operating budget for the five most recent fiscal years.
This dataset will be retained for at least 3 years from its publication date.

resource.name: Food Service Inspections
resource.description: This dataset contains records of food service inspections conducted by the Environmental Health Services Division of the the Fulton County Board of Health, which is responsible for the regulation of establishments where food is served to the public within Fulton County.  Inspections are conducted for the purpose of assuring proper sanitation practices that minimize hazards from cross-contamination, improper cooking, handling, and temperature maintenance of foods, potable water contamination, improper garbage and refuse disposal, and poor insect and rodent control.  This dataset is related to the following datasets: Food Service Violations, Food Service Violation Comments and Food Service Temperature Violations.
columns_description: A unique numeric record identifier. This is not part of the source inspection data but rather is a number generated in the process of extracting the data from the source.
The date and time of the end of the inspection.

The overall score (0-100) resulting from the inspection

The Risk Type determines the frequency at which the establishment must be inspected. Risk Type 3 represents the highest risk and requires the highest frequency of inspection.  Detailed information on risk types can be found at https://dph.georgia.gov/sites/dph.georgia.gov/files/EnvHealth/Food/InterpretationManual/10InterpretationManualInspectionsComplainceProcedures.pdf.

resource.name: Food Service Inspection Temperature Observations
resource.description: This dataset contains observations of food temperatures recorded by Fulton County Board of Health environmental health specialists during food service inspections.  Observations include the common name of the food as well as the condition, process, and location of the food at the time of monitoring e.g. hot holding, refrigerator, prep table.  Recorded temperatures are as indicated on the inspector’s thermometer.
columns_description: A letter grade based on the inspection score (A=90-100, B=80-89, C=70-79, U=0-69).
The date and time of the start of the inspection.
The scheduled date of a followup inspection if needed.

Detailed information on risk types can be found at https://dph.georgia.gov/sites/dph.georgia.gov/files/EnvHealth/Food/InterpretationManual/10InterpretationManualInspectionsComplainceProcedures.pdf.

resource.name: Election Results
resource.description: This data set consists of all Fulton County Election results from April 2012 to present. Included with each record is the race, candidate, precinct, number of election day votes, number of absentee by mail votes, number of advance in person votes, number of provisional votes, total number of votes, name of election, and date of election. This data set is updated after each election.
columns_description: Number of ballots cast
Number of early votes
Voting precinct that the results are from
Position the candidate is running for
Total number of absentee, advance, provisional, and election day votes
Date of the election
Number of registered voters
Person running for a position
Number of election day votes
Number of absentee ballots
Number of provisional votes
Percentage of registered voters that voted
Name of the election

domain_metadata.value: This dataset will be retained for at least 3 years from its publication date.
Fulton County Board of Registration and Elections
